intro: Braya rubicunda, commonly known as the red-bracted bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the arctic and alpine regions of North America. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit and bright red bracts that surround its small, white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to cold, harsh environments. Braya rubicunda is often found in tundra and alpine meadows, where it contributes to the biodiversity of these unique ecosystems.
